user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of iov_max_init_:
```c
static void
iov_max_init_ (void)
{
  long res = sysconf (_SC_IOV_MAX);
  if (res >= 0)
    mhd_iov_max_ = (unsigned long) res;
  else
  {
#if defined(IOV_MAX)
    mhd_iov_max_ = IOV_MAX;
#else  /* ! IOV_MAX */
    mhd_iov_max_ = 8; /* Should be the safe limit */
#endif /* ! IOV_MAX */
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
long res = sysconf (_SC_IOV_MAX);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment calls the POSIX library function sysconf(_SC_IOV_MAX). There is no call from sysconf back to iov_max_init_ (directly or indirectly) in the shown code, so no recursion occurs. Only if sysconf were somehow implemented to call iov_max_init_ (not the case for the standard sysconf) would Rule 17.2 be violated.
